author: USA TODAY Fantasy Sports
title: Week 4 fantasy football tips
text:
Eagles running back DeMarco Murray sat out last week with a hamstring injury and has gained just 21 yards on 11 carries. (Photo: James Lang, USA TODAY Sports)
A few additional fantasy nuggets to help owners set their Week 4 lineups, including injuries, sit/start matchup and the stats of the week.
Injury report
WR Eric Decker, Jets (questionable)
Didn’t play in Week 3 because of a knee injury, but early kickoff in London will help fantasy owners adjust.
QB Andrew Luck, Colts (probable)
Sore shoulder doesn’t appear to be a big deal for Sunday, but he’ll likely take it easy the rest of the week in practice.
WR Sammy Watkins, Bills (questionable)
Calf injury doesn’t seem to be getting better. He’ll likely face Giants cover corner Prince Amukamara if he does play.
RB DeMarco Murray, Eagles (questionable)
He’s had a full week to rest his hamstring, but Ryan Mathews and Darren Sproles have been effective in his place.
WR Victor Cruz, Giants (doubtful)
This looked like it might have been the week for Cruz’s season debut, but his ailing calf flared up in practice.
WR DeSean Jackson, Redskins (questionable)
Still isn’t moving well enough to practice, which could mean another week on the sidelines – and no deep threat for Kirk Cousins.
QB Drew Brees, Saints (questionable)
Shoulder seems to be responding well, as evidenced by him working with the first-team on Wednesday.
RB Marshawn Lynch, Seahawks (questionable)
Monday night game makes waiting for his hamstring to heal an even riskier play – unless you also have backup Thomas Rawls.
-- Steve Gardner, USA TODAY Sports
USA TODAY FANTASY SPORTS
Week 4 fantasy football rankings
Key matchup
START: WR Marvin Jones, Bengals
Jones had 94 receiving yards in Week 3 and has scored in back-to-back games. He gets a Kansas City Chiefs secondary that's allowed 57 receptions and nine touchdowns to wide receivers. His $3,800 salary in FantasyScore is an absolute steal.
SIT: WR John Brown, Cardinals
Outside of a touchdown catch in Week 1, Brown hasn't lived up to the hype. It's been the Larry Fitzgerald show Arizona and Brown can't be trusted anymore. Plus, the St. Louis Rams have allowed just one touchdown to wideouts this year. Brown isn't worth the $4,400 FantasyScore.com investment in Week 4.
— Marc Caviglia, BrunoBoys.net
FANTASYSCORE
FantasyScore 1-Day Fantasy Leagues
Stats of the week
5
Rushing touchdowns from inside the 10-yard line for Atlanta Falcons RB Devonta Freeman, which ties him with Jamaal Charles of the Kansas City Chiefs for the most in the NFL after three weeks.
-- Tony Holm, FantasySharks.com
215
Team-high receiving yards for Dallas Cowboys running back Lance Dunbar. PPR owners take note: He’s caught 21 of his 23 targets, both of which lead all NFL running backs.
-- Ken Pomponio, TheHuddle.com
he matchups for Week 4 in the NFL with each team's offensive and defensive ranking. New England and Tennessee are on bye. (Photo: USA TODAY Sports)
